page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN SUTTON
page.content: Although Sutton has always been an agricultural village few people are now employed on the land. Changes in farming practices and increased mechanization have reduced the need for manual labour. Some people are employed by local businesses but many people travel into Norwich and Yarmouth to work. Others are employed at the nearby Bacton Gas Terminal and local R.A.F. stations at Coltishall and Neatishead. The small businesses, shops and boatyards of Stalham also provide work for Sutton people. Some seasonal holiday work is also available.
